name: Crowdin
description: Closed source cloud-based localization technology and services company.

name: Inlang
description: The globalization ecosystem for software companies.

name: LocaleApp
description: App for localization and translation.

name: Transifex
description: Proprietary, web-based translation platform, globalization management system (GMS).

name: Weblate
description: Copylefted libre web-based continuous translation platform.

name: SimpleLocalize
description: A simple translation management for software projects.

name: Tolgee
description: Open-source, developer & translator friendly platform enabling users to translate directly in the app they develop.

name: Lokalise
description: Translation platform for developers.

name: Locize
description: Proprietary translation platform.

name: Zanata
description: Web-based translation platform for translators, content creators and developers to manage localisation projects.

name: Traduora
description: A platform to manage translation workflow in teams.

name: GitLocalize
description: Powerful localization platform that syncs with your GitHub repository and lets you continuously translate its content.

name: Respresso
description: Collaborative online resource manager for localizations, images, colors, etc. that generates platform-specific files and delivers them directly to your source code.

name: PO file editor
description: A free tool for translating PO files for localization with Gettext.

name: RTranslator
description: A simultaneous translator app for Android based on Google's API.

name: Crow Translate
description: A simple and lightweight translator for Linux and Windows that allows to translate and speak text using Google, Yandex and Bing translate API.

name: Copy Translator
description: An app for Windows, Mac and Linux that automatically translate and adapt a text when copied in the clipboard.

name: LibreTranslate
description: 100% Self-Hosted web app to translate text, based on Argos Translate.

name: OmegaT
description: Free translation memory / CAT software that works on Windows, macOS and Linux.

name: Argos Translate
description: Completely open source offline translation app written in Python and based on OpenNMT. It can also be used as a Python library.

name: Fink
description: Translation editor / CAT software with no-code setup and repository-based operation.

name: Project Fluent
description: Asymetric translations (eg. gender variations) for localization.

name: Bergamot
description: Client-side translation in the browser.

name: Watson Language Translator
description: A service on the IBM Cloud that enables dynamically translation news, patents, or conversational documents.

name: DeepL Translator
description: A neural machine translation service launched in August 2017 and owned by Cologne based DeepL SE.

name: Amazon Translate
description: A neural machine translation service.

name: ModernMT
description: A self-learning machine translation service that improves from user corrections as user keep using it.

name: Microsoft Translator
description: A multilingual machine translation cloud service provided by Microsoft.

name: deep-translator
description: A flexible free and unlimited (depending on the translator used) library written in Python to translate between different languages in a simple way using multiple translators, it can also be used directly in the prompt.

name: Translator
description: A translator library based on the translation interface of Google, Yandex, Microsoft (Bing), Baidu, Alibaba, Tencent, NetEase (Youdao), Sogou, Deepl, etc.

name: I18next
description: Internationalization-framework written in and for JavaScript.

name: react-i18next
description: Powerful internationalization framework for React / React Native which is based on i18next.

name: MDN i18n
description: Functions to internationalize your browser extension. You can use these APIs to get localized strings from locale files packaged with your extension.

name: Ruby I18n
description: Rails internationalization (i18n) API.

name: Quasar I18n
description: App internationalization (i18n) in Quasar framework.

name: Vue I18n
description: Internationalization plugin for Vue.js.

name: i18n Ally
description: Extension for VSCode, all in one about i18n.

name: Translate
description: A set of software and documentation designed to help make the lives of localizers both more productive and less frustrating.

name: Python-i18n
description: Python internationalization (i18n) package.

name: Jsproxy for Crowdin
description: Add-on to Crowdin.

name: Moment.js
description: Parse, validate, manipulate and display dates and times in JavaScript.

name: WPML
description: A WordPress plugin that allows running multilingual websites with a single WordPress install.

name: FormatJS
description: A modular collection of JavaScript libraries for internationalization that are focused on formatting numbers, dates, and strings for displaying to people.

name: Polyglot
description: A fast, painless, open-source internationalization plugin for Jekyll blogs.

name: ICU - International Components for Unicode
description: International Components for Unicode - A mature, widely used set of C/C++ and Java libraries providing Unicode and Globalization support for software applications.

name: Django docs - i18n
description: i18n - Part of the Django docs, focused on internationalization and localization.

name: Localizejs
description: Translations for websites and applications to new languages and streamline translation workflow.

name: ParaglideJS
description: Synchronous, typesafe and lightweight i18n library.

name: SwiftGoogleTranslate
description: A framework to use cloud translation API by Google in Swift.

name: attranslate
description: A tool for semi-automated translations of cross-platform apps or websites.

name: AutoML Translation Documentation
description: AutoML Translation by Google.

name: npm i18n
description: Lightweight simple translation module with dynamic json storage.

name: Pootle
description: An online translation management tool with a translation interface focused on localization of applications' graphical user interfaces. It is used by LibreOffice.

name: Globalize
description: A JavaScript library for internationalization and localization that leverage the official Unicode CLDR JSON data.

name: SimpleLocalize CLI
description: A CLI for finding translation keys in project files.

name: Stack Overflow Q&A-1
description: Localization and internationalization, what's the difference?

name: Stack Overflow Q&A-2
description: What is the actual differences between i18n/l10n/g11n and specifically what does each mean for development?

name: W3C
description: Localization vs. internationalization.

name: Internationalization vs. Localization: The Difference Between l10n and I18n
description: Blog post about the difference between l10n and I18n from Crowdin.

name: Angular and i18n
description: Angular i18n guide.

name: Debian manuals
description: Chapter 8: i18n and l10n.

name: Developer Chrome i18n
description: Internationalizing your app.

name: Software Globalization, Berkeley.edu - slides
description: slides - "Software globalization and adding languages on computers and mobile devices" by Craig Cummings (slides).

name: Flutter i18n
description: Internationalizing Flutter apps.

name: What is 'hreflang'?
description: What is hreflang attribute and how it can affect your SERP.

name: Globalization and localization in ASP.NET Core
description: Article about Globalization and localization in ASP.NET Core.

name: Computer-assisted translation
description: CAT (computer-aided translation) tools are typically understood to mean programs that specifically facilitate the actual translation process. This article describe: translation memory software, language search-engine software, terminology management software, alignment software, interactive machine translation, augmented translation.

name: Approaches to Machine Translation
description: A paper-review on different techniques for machine translation.

name: Neural Machine Translation
description: A paper-review that trace back the origins of modern NMT architectures to word and sentence embeddings and earlier examples of the encoder-decoder network family. It will conclude with a short survey of more recent trends in the field.

name: Speakt
description: Well-rounded resource, offering in-depth information from the best professionals in the industry on everything related to translation.

name: Lexico
description: Provides a collection of dictionaries of English and Spanish, and curiosities about many words and languages (in the "Explore" section). It is produced by Oxford University Press.

name: The Translator's Teacup
description: Contains good tips for beginner translators.

name: Speaking of Translation
description: Run by two outstanding experts in the field of translation and localization. You can listen to audio files covering their tips and opinions on the freelance translator's work.

name: eMpTy Pages
description: Presents extremely detailed descriptions and opinions about localization management, collaborative translation platforms, translation management systems, machine translation, as well as the localization industry's biggest players.

name: UWashingtonX's I18n and l10n
description: A collection of 3 courses of internationalization and internationalization for digital products provided by the University of Washington.

name: Basic English Grammar and punctuation
description: English grammar course for beginners provided by the University of California.

name: Intermediate English Grammar and punctuation
description: English grammar course for people with experience provided by the University of California.

name: Advanced English Grammar and punctuation
description: English grammar course for experts provided by the University of California.

name: Natural Language Processing
description: Teaches how to use machine learning to understand and manipulate human language. It requires a working knowledge of machine learning, intermediate Python experience including DL frameworks & proficiency in calculus, linear algebra, & statistics.

name: Machine Translation
description: Explains the basic principles of translation algoritms. It is provided by the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (Germany).

name: Statistical Machine Translation
description: Establishes background in NLP and statistics, then develops the basics through to current research. By the end readers can build their own translation systems. The author is Philipp Koehn.

name: Neural Machine Translation
description: This introduction to machine translation starts from the basics of neural network methods and reaches the state of the art, while giving historical, linguistic, and applied context. Code examples in Python give a hands-on blueprint for implementation. The author is still Philipp Koehn.

name: Translation: An advanced resource book for students
description: Introduces the theory and practice of translation from a variety of linguistic and cultural angles. The authors are Basil Hatim and Jeremy Munday.

name: Glocalization Strategy Playbook
description: A Guide for Localization and Globalization Professionals by the GILT forum.

name: Google Crowdsource
description: Crowdsourcing platform developed by Google intended to improve a host of Google services through the user-facing training of different algorithms (with translation and translation validation section).

name: LocalizationLab
description: Global community of 7000+ contributors who support the translation and localization of Internet freedom tools.

name: Pontoon
description: Various Mozilla localization projects.
